dcterms:creator: Anatol Rapoport
Albert M. Chammah
Carol J. Orwant
dcterms:description: A classic game theoretical model that explores conflict and cooperation through the lens of the Prisoner's Dilemma, where agents can choose to cooperate or defect, impacting their payoffs based on their choices and those of their opponents.
dcterms:title: Prisoner’s Dilemma (PD) game

dcterms:creator: Michael Wooldridge
dcterms:description: A dataset that provides insights into how social norms influence the behavior of agents in multi-agent systems, particularly in the context of cooperation and reputation.
dcterms:title: Social Norms

dcterms:creator: Martin A. Nowak
Karl Sigmund
dcterms:description: Models that explore the evolution of indirect reciprocity, focusing on how reputation influences cooperation among agents in a dynamic environment.
dcterms:title: Indirect Reciprocity Models

dcterms:creator: Tim Borglund
Shuyue Hu
Ho-Fung Leung
dcterms:description: A dataset that examines the effects of fixed-strategy agents on the emergence of local conventions in multi-agent systems, highlighting the role of coordination mechanisms.
dcterms:title: Coordination Mechanisms in Multi-Agent Systems

dcterms:creator: Jones Granatyr
Vanderson Botelho
Otto Robert Lessing
Edson Emílio Scalabrin
Jean-Paul Barthès
Fabrício Enembreck
dcterms:description: A comprehensive overview of trust and reputation models in multi-agent systems, discussing various approaches and their implications for cooperation.
dcterms:title: Trust and Reputation Models

dcterms:creator: Fernando P. Santos
Francisco C. Santos
Jorge M. Pacheco
dcterms:description: This dataset explores the complexity of social norms and their relationship with past reputations in the evolution of cooperation, providing insights into how these factors interact.
dcterms:title: Social Norm Complexity

dcterms:creator: Nicolas Anastassacos
Stephen Hailes
Mirco Musolesi
dcterms:description: A dataset that investigates partner selection mechanisms for the emergence of cooperation in multi-agent systems using reinforcement learning techniques.
dcterms:title: Cooperation Dynamics in Multi-Agent Systems
